prompt: Comment puis-je m'assurer que seuls les fichiers image ou PDF d'une taille maximale de 10 Mo peuvent être téléchargés en tant que pièces jointes sur l'ensemble du wiki?
expected_answer:
Pour vous assurer que seuls les fichiers image ou PDF d'une taille maximale de 10 Mo peuvent être téléchargés en tant que pièces jointes sur l'ensemble du wiki, suivez ces étapes:

**Étape 1: Configurer les types MIME autorisés**

Modifiez le fichier de configuration `xwiki.properties` dans votre installation et ajoutez ou mettez à jour la ligne suivante pour configurer les restrictions de type MIME par défaut au niveau de la ferme:
```
attachment.upload.allowList=image/*,application/pdf
```
Cela permettra uniquement les fichiers image (avec n'importe quel sous-type, par exemple `image/jpeg`, `image/png`, etc.) et les fichiers PDF à télécharger, et bloquera tous les autres types MIME.

**Étape 2: Configurer la taille maximale de la pièce jointe**

Pour définir la taille maximale de la pièce jointe sur 10 Mo, suivez ces étapes:

1. Allez sur `http://<votrewiki>/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=object`
2. Cliquez sur la ligne qui dit XWikiPreferences 0 (juste en dessous de la ligne qui dit Objects of type XWiki.XWikiPreferences (1))
3. Faites défiler jusqu'au champ qui dit Maximum Upload Size et changez le nombre en `10485760` (10 Mo en octets)
4. Faites défiler jusqu'en bas et cliquez sur "Enregistrer"
5. Répétez pour chaque (sous-)wiki pour lequel vous devez définir cette configuration!

To ensure that only image or PDF files with a maximum size of 10 MB can be uploaded as attachments throughout the wiki, you will need to make several configurations in your XWiki setup.

First, you need to configure the attachment storage to store attachments in the filesystem and limit their size. In your `xwiki.cfg` file, add the following lines:
```makefile
xwiki.store.attachment.hint = fsattach
xwiki.store.attachment.versioning=0
storage.attachment.recyclebin=0
store.fsattach.cleanOnStartup=false
store.fsattach.maxsize=10485760
store.fsattach.allowedtypes=image/png,image/jpeg,image/gif,application/pdf
```
Here's what each line does:

* `xwiki.store.attachment.hint = fsattach`: This sets the default attachment store to the filesystem.
* `xwiki.store.attachment.versioning=0`: This disables attachment versioning, saving storage space.
* `storage.attachment.recyclebin=0`: This disables the recycle bin for attachments.
* `store.fsattach.cleanOnStartup=false`: This prevents XWiki from cleaning up empty directories in the Filesystem Attachment Store on startup.
* `store.fsattach.maxsize=10485760`: This sets the maximum size for attachments to 10 MB.
* `store.fsattach.allowedtypes=image/png,image/jpeg,image/gif,application/pdf`: This allows only image and PDF file types to be uploaded as attachments.

Next, you need to configure the wiki's access rights to deny the "Programming" permission to all users, as this permission allows users to execute arbitrary Java code in the wiki. In your wiki's administration panel, navigate to "Access Rights" > "Permission Types" and set the "Programming" permission to "Deny" for all users and groups.

Finally, you need to configure the wiki's access rights to deny the "Script" permission to all users in subwikis, as this permission allows users to write scripts in wiki pages. In your wiki's administration panel, navigate to "Access Rights" > "Permission Types" and set the "Script" permission to "Deny" for all users and groups in subwikis.

With these configurations in place, only image and PDF files with a maximum size of 10 MB can be uploaded as attachments throughout the wiki, and only users with the necessary permissions can execute scripts.

sources.content:
# Versions

When a user uploads an attachment and then uploads another attachment with the exact same name, you can decide whether or not to keep a version history of the attachments like you do with documents.  
XWiki stores all document attachment versions by default which costs more storage space. If you need only latest versions of attachments, you can disable attachment version control by editing your [xwiki.cfg](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Configuration/) and adding:

xwiki.store.attachment.versioning=0# Deletion

Deleted attachments are stored in a recycle bin so that they can be restored along with the document when rolling back or previewing an earlier version where the attachment should be visible. To disable this feature, edit [xwiki.cfg](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Configuration/) and add:

storage.attachment.recyclebin=0You can view the list of deleted attachments in your wiki and delete them permanently by going to XWiki.DeletedAttachments in your wiki.

# Attachment Storage

XWiki offers plugin attachment storage mechanisms so you can store your attachments in the database or directly in the filesystem.

Generally metadata for attachment and deleted attachments stay in the database whatever store is used for the content. The metadata contains the type of store used for the content allowing each attachment to choose a different store. The consequence is that what you configure is the **default** store for a new attachment and not the store used for all attachments.

#### Directory cleanup

Since [XWiki 6.0M2](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki61M2), it is possible to save time on startup by preventing XWiki from cleaning up empty directories in the Filesystem Attachment Store. To do this, edit xwiki.properties and set **store.fsattach.cleanOnStartup** to false. If you do this, you will be responsible for cleanup of empty directories yourself.

## Database Attachment Store

The default before 10.5.

This attachment storage mechanism stores your attachments in database entries in the [xwikiattachment\_content](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/DsXWikiAttachmentContent), [xwikiattachment\_archive](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/XWikiAttachmentArchive) and [xwikiattrecyclebin](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/DsXwikiRecycleBin) tables. This system allows for easy backup of your attachments by dumping the database and keeping all of your data together, but attachment size is memory constrained since the attachment content and archive must all be held in memory. As a general rule, attachments larger than 30MB are not possible.

### Switch to database attachment store

These settings should read as follows:

xwiki.store.attachment.hint = hibernate  
xwiki.store.attachment.versioning.hint = hibernate  
xwiki.store.attachment.recyclebin.content.hint=hibernate  
  
# If you need to use database store for the attachment it's probably true for deleted attachments  
xwiki.store.recyclebin.content.hint = hibernateAlso make sure they are not commented out.

When using this attachment store with a MySQL database, you must set the max\_allowed\_packet to about 3 times the size of your largest attachment since the attachment and its version history must be saved. See the [MySQL Installation guide](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL) for more information.
